title: Submission to Authorities
shortSummary: Romans 13 instructs believers on their relationship to governing authorities, emphasizing that all power is ordained by God and that submission to rulers is a matter of obedience to God. The chapter also calls Christians to love one another as the fulfillment of the law and to live holy lives in anticipation of Christ's return.
timeline: c. AD 57 - Paul's Epistle to the Romans during his third missionary journey

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle writing this epistle, providing instruction to the Roman believers on Christian conduct and theology.

keyCharacters.name: Governing Authorities
keyCharacters.description: Referred to as 'higher powers' ordained by God to maintain order and execute justice.

definitions.definition: Civil authorities or governing rulers established by God to maintain societal order.
Taxes or dues paid to governing authorities as a recognition of their God-ordained role.
A servant or agent appointed by God to carry out His purposes, here referring to civil rulers who punish evil.
Spiritual readiness and holiness that believers are to clothe themselves with, symbolizing living in truth and righteousness.

outline.heading: Submission to Governing Authorities
outline.description: Paul teaches that all authorities are established by God and that resisting them is resisting God's ordinance. Believers are to submit, pay taxes, and give respect to those in authority as they serve God's purpose.

outline.heading: Love Fulfills the Law
outline.description: Paul emphasizes that love is the fulfillment of the law, summarizing the commandments by the command to love one’s neighbor as oneself.

outline.heading: Living in the Light of Salvation
outline.description: Believers are urged to awaken from spiritual sleep, cast off sinful deeds, and live honorably by putting on Christ and resisting fleshly desires in light of the nearness of salvation.

application: Submit respectfully to governing authorities as they serve God's purpose in maintaining order.
Demonstrate love to others as the highest fulfillment of God's law in daily life.
Live with spiritual alertness and holiness, putting on Christ and rejecting sinful behaviors.
Pay taxes and honor those in authority as an act of obedience to God and conscience.

keyVerses.text: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers. For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse establishes the divine origin of governmental authority and the call to submission.

keyVerses.text: Owe no man any thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights love as the fundamental debt Christians owe, fulfilling God's law completely.

keyVerses.text: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, to fulfil the lusts thereof.
keyVerses.significance: This verse calls believers to live in Christ’s righteousness and resist sinful desires.
